metadata.subject: Mathematics
metadata.curriculumTopic: Number and Algebra, Measurement and Geometry, Statistics and Probability
metadata.curriculumSubtopic: Division facts and strategies with remainders

questions.question: What is 10 ÷ 2?
questions.explanation: 10 ÷ 2 = 5. Ten divided by 2 equals 5, or how many groups of 2 are in 10?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 10 ÷ 2? 10 ÷ 2 = 5. Ten divided by 2 equals 5, or how many groups of 2 are in 10?

questions.question: Emma has 12 cookies. She wants to share them equally among 3 friends. How many cookies will each friend get?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Emma has 12 cookies. She wants to share them equally among 3 friends. How many cookies will each friend get? 12 ÷ 3 = 4. Each friend will get 4 cookies.

questions.question: What is 15 ÷ 3?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 15 ÷ 3? 15 ÷ 3 = 5. Fifteen divided by 3 equals 5.

questions.question: Tom has 18 marbles. He puts them into groups of 6. How many groups does he make?
questions.explanation: 18 ÷ 6 = 3. Tom makes 3 groups with 6 marbles in each group.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Tom has 18 marbles. He puts them into groups of 6. How many groups does he make? 18 ÷ 6 = 3. Tom makes 3 groups with 6 marbles in each group.

questions.question: What is 20 ÷ 4?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 20 ÷ 4? 20 ÷ 4 = 5. Twenty divided by 4 equals 5.

questions.question: Sarah has 16 stickers. She gives the same number to each of her 4 sisters. How many stickers does each sister get?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Sarah has 16 stickers. She gives the same number to each of her 4 sisters. How many stickers does each sister get? 16 ÷ 4 = 4. Each sister gets 4 stickers.

questions.question: What is 24 ÷ 6?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 24 ÷ 6? 24 ÷ 6 = 4. Twenty-four divided by 6 equals 4.

questions.question: A teacher has 14 pencils to share equally among 2 students. How many pencils will each student get?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A teacher has 14 pencils to share equally among 2 students. How many pencils will each student get? 14 ÷ 2 = 7. Each student will get 7 pencils.

questions.question: What is 21 ÷ 7?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 21 ÷ 7? 21 ÷ 7 = 3. Twenty-one divided by 7 equals 3.

questions.question: Jake arranges 27 books into 3 equal piles. How many books are in each pile?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Jake arranges 27 books into 3 equal piles. How many books are in each pile? 27 ÷ 3 = 9. Each pile has 9 books.

questions.question: What is 35 ÷ 5?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 35 ÷ 5? 35 ÷ 5 = 7. Thirty-five divided by 5 equals 7.

questions.question: Lily has 30 flowers. She puts them in vases with 6 flowers in each vase. How many vases does she use?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Lily has 30 flowers. She puts them in vases with 6 flowers in each vase. How many vases does she use? 30 ÷ 6 = 5. Lily uses 5 vases.

questions.question: What is 56 ÷ 8?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 56 ÷ 8? 56 ÷ 8 = 7. This is the inverse of 8 × 7 = 56.

questions.question: A classroom has 54 students arranged in 6 equal rows. How many students are in each row?
questions.explanation: 54 ÷ 6 = 9. There are 9 students in each row.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A classroom has 54 students arranged in 6 equal rows. How many students are in each row? 54 ÷ 6 = 9. There are 9 students in each row.

questions.question: What is 72 ÷ 9?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 72 ÷ 9? 72 ÷ 9 = 8. This is the inverse of 9 × 8 = 72.

questions.question: A farmer collects 63 eggs and packs them into cartons of 7 eggs each. How many cartons does he fill?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A farmer collects 63 eggs and packs them into cartons of 7 eggs each. How many cartons does he fill? 63 ÷ 7 = 9. The farmer fills 9 cartons.

questions.question: What is 48 ÷ 6?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 48 ÷ 6? 48 ÷ 6 = 8. This is the inverse of 6 × 8 = 48.

questions.question: A library arranges 56 books on 7 shelves with the same number of books on each shelf. How many books are on each shelf?
questions.explanation: 56 ÷ 7 = 8. There are 8 books on each shelf.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A library arranges 56 books on 7 shelves with the same number of books on each shelf. How many books are on each shelf? 56 ÷ 7 = 8. There are 8 books on each shelf.

questions.question: What is 81 ÷ 9?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 81 ÷ 9? 81 ÷ 9 = 9. This is the inverse of 9 × 9 = 81.

questions.question: There are 54 crayons in boxes. Each box contains 9 crayons. How many boxes are there?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: There are 54 crayons in boxes. Each box contains 9 crayons. How many boxes are there? 54 ÷ 9 = 6. There are 6 boxes of crayons.

questions.question: What is 64 ÷ 8?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 64 ÷ 8? 64 ÷ 8 = 8. This is the inverse of 8 × 8 = 64.

questions.question: A parking lot has 56 cars arranged in 8 equal rows. How many cars are in each row?
questions.explanation: 56 ÷ 8 = 7. There are 7 cars in each row.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A parking lot has 56 cars arranged in 8 equal rows. How many cars are in each row? 56 ÷ 8 = 7. There are 7 cars in each row.

questions.question: What is 45 ÷ 9?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 45 ÷ 9? 45 ÷ 9 = 5. This is the inverse of 9 × 5 = 45.

questions.question: Maya has 72 flowers to arrange in 9 bouquets with the same number of flowers in each. How many flowers are in each bouquet?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Maya has 72 flowers to arrange in 9 bouquets with the same number of flowers in each. How many flowers are in each bouquet? 72 ÷ 9 = 8. Each bouquet has 8 flowers.

questions.question: What is 23 ÷ 4? Give your answer with a remainder.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 23 ÷ 4? Give your answer with a remainder. 23 ÷ 4 = 5 remainder 3. Check: 4 × 5 = 20, and 23 - 20 = 3.

questions.question: A school has 37 students going on a field trip. If each bus holds 8 students, how many buses are needed and how many students will be on the last bus?
questions.answer: 5 buses, 5 students on the last bus
questions.explanation: 37 ÷ 8 = 4 remainder 5. They need 5 buses total, with 5 students on the last bus.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A school has 37 students going on a field trip. If each bus holds 8 students, how many buses are needed and how many students will be on the last bus? 37 ÷ 8 = 4 remainder 5. They need 5 buses total, with 5 students on the last bus.

questions.question: What is 43 ÷ 6? Give your answer with a remainder.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 43 ÷ 6? Give your answer with a remainder. 43 ÷ 6 = 7 remainder 1. Check: 6 × 7 = 42, and 43 - 42 = 1.

questions.question: A baker has 50 cupcakes. She wants to pack them in boxes of 7. How many full boxes can she make and how many cupcakes will be left over?
questions.explanation: 50 ÷ 7 = 7 remainder 1. She can make 7 full boxes with 1 cupcake left over.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A baker has 50 cupcakes. She wants to pack them in boxes of 7. How many full boxes can she make and how many cupcakes will be left over? 50 ÷ 7 = 7 remainder 1. She can make 7 full boxes with 1 cupcake left over.

questions.question: What is 58 ÷ 9? Give your answer with a remainder.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: What is 58 ÷ 9? Give your answer with a remainder. 58 ÷ 9 = 6 remainder 4. Check: 9 × 6 = 54, and 58 - 54 = 4.

questions.question: A toy store has 65 action figures. If they put 8 figures in each display case, how many display cases will be completely filled and how many figures will be left for the last case?
questions.explanation: 65 ÷ 8 = 8 remainder 1. Eight cases will be completely filled, with 1 figure left for the last case.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A toy store has 65 action figures. If they put 8 figures in each display case, how many display cases will be completely filled and how many figures will be left for the last case? 65 ÷ 8 = 8 remainder 1. Eight cases will be completely filled, with 1 figure left for the last case.
